para.text: Except as provided in § 8-434, no person or entity shall apply a pesticide to schools, child-occupied facilities, waterbody-contingent property, or District property; provided, that a person or entity may apply:
Minimum-risk pesticides or organic pesticides; and
Any pesticide, except a District restricted-use pesticide, that is applied for the purpose of:
Controlling plants that are poisonous to touch or may cause damage to a structure or infrastructure;
Controlling insects that bite or sting, are venomous, or that may cause damage to a structure or infrastructure;
Controlling organisms that threaten the health of trees or shrubs;
Maintaining property as part of efforts by a public utility to comply with applicable vegetation management provisions of any federal or District law or regulation;
Controlling pests or weeds while engaged in agriculture or forestry;
Controlling a pest outbreak that poses an imminent threat to human health; and
In addition to the restrictions in subsection (a) of this section, the Department may establish additional restrictions on the use of District restricted-use pesticides.

If a pesticide is applied under subsection (a)(2) of this section, the person or entity applying the pesticide shall, within 7 days after the application, notify the Department of the application, the reasons for application of the pesticide, and the reason why pesticides allowed under subsection (a)(1) of this section were insufficient.

annotations.annotation: Section 14(a) of D.C. Law 19-191 provided that §§ 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 of the act shall apply as of October 1, 2013.
This section is referenced in § 8-418, § 8-434, and § 8-439.
